p: The number of species currently cataloged exceeds 500, although there are perhaps many more that exist because of, among other things, the great ease in which this aromatic plant produces hybridizations and mutations. Among the best-known species in Spain that experience greater propagation and exploitation are Thymus rumidicus hispánicos, Thymus zygis, Thymus vulgaris, Thymus hyemalis, Thymus mastichina, Thymus citríodotus, Thymus corydothymus, Thymus loscossi, Thymus pipirella, Thymus communis, etc. ( Figure 1).
